# 2.

  a.

```{r}
E1 <- rexp(10000,rate = 2)
hist(E1)
```


  b.
```{r}
E2 <- rexp(10000,rate = 3)
hist(E2)
```

  c.

```{r}
y <- pmin(E1,E2)
hist(y)
```
  d.

```{r}
1/mean(y)
```

  Answer: The sidtribution of the minimum is exponential distribution. 


# 3.

  a.

```{r}
rand.gen <-function(N=10){
  a <- 3
  m <- 31
  d <- 2 # seed
  rn <-vector(length=N)# initialising the vector
  for(i in 1:N){
    d <- (a*d)%%m
    rn[i] <- d/m
  }
  return(rn)
}
```

 b.

```{r include=FALSE}
rand.gen(N = 1000)
```

```{r}
rand.gen2 <-function(N=10){
  a <- 65539
  m <- 2^13
  d <- 2019 # seed
  rn <-vector(length=N)# initialising the vector
  for(i in 1:N){
    d <- (a*d)%%m
    rn[i] <- d/m
  }
  return(rn)
}

rn <- rand.gen2(N = 1000)
```

  c.

```{r}
rn <- 2*rn +3

hist(rn)
```

  Answer: According to histogram, the distribution of the transformed variable is **Uniform Distribution**.

  The parameters of this distribution is **a = 3, b = 5**
